content: by anna johanna a laid-back sweater for those lazy sunday mornings copyright @ anna johanna 2018 all rights reserved for personal non-commercial use only pattern support pm annaj0hanna on ravelry neulisti mnk@gmail com size xxs-xs-s m1-m2-l1 l2-xl-xxl this sweater is meant to be worn with positive ease choose a size with approx 4 /10 cm positive ease at bust circumference yarn rowan fine tweed 100% single ply wool 90 m / 25 g or other fingering weight yarn 10-11-11 11-12-13 14-15-17 skeins shown in color leyburn yardage 880-910-960 1040-1085-1140 1220-1330-1465 yards / 805- 830-875 950-990-1040 1120- 1215-1340 m nee dles us 1½ 2 5 mm and us 2½ 3 0 mm circular needles 24 /60 cm long and dpns if you prefe r to work the sleeves with them adjust the needle size if necessary to obtain right gauge ga uge 25 sts x 38 rnds = 4x4 / 10x10 cm in stockinette stitch with the bigger needles worked in the round after blocking other 8 stitch markers scrap yarn tapestry needle finished measurements a sleeve length 12 / 30 cm b upper arm circumference 11 75-12 25-12 5 13 75-13 75-14 5 15 75- 16 5-17 25 / 29 5-30 5-31 34 5-34 5-36 39-41 5-43 cm c armhole depth 6 75-7 25-7 25 7 5-7 75-8 8 25-8 75-9 25 / 17-18-18 5 19-19 5-20 20 5-22-23 cm d bust waist and hip circumference 35 25-35 75-37 75 40 25-41 5-44 25 46 75-50-55 / 88-89 5-94 5 101-104-110 5 117-125-137 5 cm e body length from underarm 16 25 / 41 cm copyright @ anna johanna 2018 all rights reserved for personal non-commercial use only 2 pattern support pm annaj0hanna on ravelry neulisti mnk@gmail com abbreviations 2yo = double yarn over on the next m1l = make 1 left pick up the yarn rs = right side round knit only one yarn over and between sts from front to back and drop the other knit/purl it through the backloop sm = slip marker co = cast on m1r = make 1 right pick up the yarn ssk = slip slip knit slip 1 st knitwise between sts from back to front and slip 1 st knitwise move the sts back dpns = double pointed needles knit/purl it onto the left needle and knit together through the back loop k = knit p = purl st = stitch k2tog = knit 2 sts together pm = place marker ws = wrong side rm = remove marker instructions la grasse matinée is worked seamlessly top down it features ¾ raglan sleeves and pretty little eyelets in the hem and sleeve cuffs this is a great pattern for you very first top down sweater start here 2nd row ws p115-115-113 113-113-109 109-107- using us 1½ 2 5 mm needles and the long tail cast 101 slipping markers work a shadow wrap turn on co 160 sts place a marker for the beginning of 3rd row k to marker m1l sm
